text:
<@U02N5UCCSNB> that likely stems from one of two things (potentially both)
• you’ve set up the proxy connection incorrectly - common causes are requesting a HubSpot page directly by the published URL, or making the TLS handshake improperly because the proxy doesn’t perform the SNI aspect correctly 
• Or, you tripped a rate limit or firewall due to requests originating from a small range of IP addresses instead of through a load balanced environment where requests hit HubSpot from a wider pool of IPs. 
Give this a review to see if it helps - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Lessons-Learned-from-Setting-up-a-Reverse-Proxy-With-HubSpot-CMS/td-p/435961|https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Lessons-Learned-from-Setting-up-a-Reverse-Proxy-With-HubSpot-CMS/td-p/435961>

how can i get access to start working with *CMS quotes theme,* I’m trying in a client account and in a developer account and cant fetch it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-from-the-cms-quotes-theme-beta>

Is your account ungated for the beta?
If you can’t see cms-quotes-theme in the @HubSpot folder in the Design Manager  you’re not in the beta.
info on how to get into the beta and what to expect: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/quotes#interested-in-joining-this-beta->

Hi, my name is Uzma. I need some help in integrating “The Events Calendar” app to HS. I have created HS developer account then created an app and now trying to connect HubSpot but it’s giving an error. Please help!
